text.paragraph: a.Chronic sickness exhibited by patient b. healthcare concerns refer to underlying clinical facts: I. documented hypertension problem ii. documented hypothyroidism problem iii. watch weight of patient iv. documented anemia problem

Diet: Start a diabetic low salt diet. Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised. Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for Followup with outpatient facility for immunosuppressive therapy. If there is fever greater than 101.5F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness, advised to contact emergency.

tr.td: Start ceftriaxone injection, recon soln 100gram, Sig:Two times daily, Dur: 9d, Qty: 1 Syringe, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start cefpodoxime, tablet 200mg, Sig:Two times daily, Dur: 9d, Qty: 18 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start Tylenol Extra Strength, tablet 500mg, Sig:As needed, Dur: 9d, Qty: 18 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start Aranesp (in polysorbate), syringe 100mcg/0.5 mL, Sig:Once a week, Dur: 7d, Qty: 1 Syringe, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start clindamycin HCl oral, capsule 300mg, Sig:Three times daily, Dur: 8d, Qty: 24 Capsule, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start torsemide oral, tablet 20mg, Sig:Daily, Dur: 8d, Qty: 8 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start prednisolone, 50mg, Sig:daily, Dur: 12d, Qty: 12 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start fenofibric acid, tablet 35mg, Sig:At the hour of sleep, Dur: 11d, Qty: 11 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start mycophenolate sodium, tablet,delayed release (DR/EC) 360mg, Sig:Two times daily, Dur: 4d, Qty: 8 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start everolimus, tablet 0.5mg, Sig:Two times daily, Dur: 27d, Qty: 54 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Start ciprofloxacin HCl oral, tablet 250mg, Sig:Three times daily, Dur: 31d, Qty: 93 Tablet, Ref: 0, May Substitute
Influenza Injection patient rejected receiving this immunization
Dietary Consult BMI outside of range
Start levothyroxine oral, capsule 100mcg, Sig:Daily, Dur: 8d, Qty: 8 Capsule, Ref: 0, May Substitute

The patient was found to have anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated ms. Rebecca for anemia during the 2 day stay at Community health Hospitals. Ms Rebecca recovered from anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever greater than 101.5F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency. Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for Follow up with Outpatient facility for Immunosuppressive therapy.
Need to gain more energy to do regular activities. Negotiated Goal to keep Body Temperature at 98-99 degrees Fahrenheit with regular monitoring.

Diet: Start a diabetic low salt diet. Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised. Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for Followup with outpatient facility for immunosuppressive therapy. If there is fever greater than 101.5F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness, advised to contact emergency.
